segment.source: How to Apply an App-V Project Template (App-V 4.6 SP1)
segment.target: How to Apply an App-V Project Template (App-V 4.6 SP1)

segment.source: How to Apply an App-V Project Template (App-V 4.6 SP1)
segment.target: How to Apply an App-V Project Template (App-V 4.6 SP1)

segment.source: How to Apply an App-V Project Template (App-V 4.6 SP1)
segment.target: How to Apply an App-V Project Template (App-V 4.6 SP1)

segment.source: You can use an App-V project template to apply common settings associated with an existing virtual application package to a new virtual application package.
segment.target: You can use an App-V project template to apply common settings associated with an existing virtual application package to a new virtual application package.

segment.source: Using App-V project templates can help streamline the process of creating virtual application packages by configuring common settings before you begin sequencing an application.
segment.target: Using App-V project templates can help streamline the process of creating virtual application packages by configuring common settings before you begin sequencing an application.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can only apply an App-V project template when you are creating a new virtual application package.
segment.target: You can only apply an App-V project template when you are creating a new virtual application package.

segment.source: Applying project templates to existing virtual application packages is not supported.
segment.target: Applying project templates to existing virtual application packages is not supported.

segment.source: Additionally, you cannot use a project template in conjunction with a Package Accelerator.
segment.target: Additionally, you cannot use a project template in conjunction with a Package Accelerator.

segment.source: For more information about creating App-V project templates, see How to Create an App-V Project Template (App-V 4.6 SP1).
segment.target: For more information about creating App-V project templates, see How to Create an App-V Project Template (App-V 4.6 SP1).

segment.source: To apply an App-V project template
segment.target: To apply an App-V project template

segment.source: To start the Microsoft Application Virtualization Sequencer, on the computer on which App-V Sequencer is installed, click StartAll ProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.
segment.target: To start the Microsoft Application Virtualization Sequencer, on the computer on which App-V Sequencer is installed, click StartAll ProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.

segment.source: To create a new virtual application package by using an App-V project template, click FileNew From Template.
segment.target: To create a new virtual application package by using an App-V project template, click FileNew From Template.

segment.source: To select the project template that you want to use, browse to the directory where the project template is saved, select the project template, and then click Open.
segment.target: To select the project template that you want to use, browse to the directory where the project template is saved, select the project template, and then click Open.

segment.source: Create the new virtual application package.
segment.target: Create the new virtual application package.

segment.source: The settings saved with the specified template will be applied to the new virtual application package that you are creating.
segment.target: The settings saved with the specified template will be applied to the new virtual application package that you are creating.

segment.source: For more information about creating a new virtual application package, see How to Determine Which Type of Application to Sequence (App-V 4.6 SP1), and select the appropriate procedure.
segment.target: For more information about creating a new virtual application package, see How to Determine Which Type of Application to Sequence (App-V 4.6 SP1), and select the appropriate procedure.
